Can be configured with a canonicalization rule like this:

             <newObject name="testing_canonicalization" class="org.archive.crawler.url.canonicalize.RegexRule">
                 <boolean name="enabled">true</boolean>
                 <string name="matching-regex">^(.*index.php/topic,7413.0/?)(board=.*)$</string>
                 <string name="format">${1}</string>
                 <string name="comment">removes board=.* from URI</string>
             </newObject>

Note that this will only prevents heritrix from crawling all these URIs - the URIs written into the ARC file(s) will be the original ones. 
Another issues arises when you want to access such content with software like the open source wayback. Either at index-time or lookup time 
(or both) you might want to apply the same canoicalization rule.
